labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Launch updates by themselves can't express partial VMSA values
issues.author: deeglaze
issues.body: The SEV-ES reset vector address has to be in the AP VMSAs' RIP and CS_BASE, but that's specified by the firmware whereas the rest of the VMSA is specified by the VMM.

issues.title: Size of 2MB pages
issues.author: jraman567
issues.body:
> If page2m is set and content is present, it must not exceed size 0x100000B

Did you mean 0x200000B? CMDBUF_SNP_LAUNCH_UPDATE.PAGE_SIZE says PAGE_SIZE can be 4 KB or 2 MB.

comments.author: deeglaze
comments.body: I've removed the page size entirely since the measurements are always in terms of 4KiB pages.

issues.title: Format of PAGE_INFO.CONTENTS
issues.author: jraman567
issues.body:
> The content is appended with zeros to reach the expected size.

From your description, "contents" would be the un-digested contents. Is there a reason for this?

We can use the SHA-384 digest of the contents here unless you see a problem.

issues.title: Missing PAGE_INFO.GPA
issues.author: jraman567
issues.body:
> Since the VMM only has to provide the page type and digest of the contents, the rest of the fields of a sevsnp-launch-update-data-map have default values when translated to a PAGE_INFO without the DIGEST_CUR field.

We must also know the page's GPA to compute the measurement.

comments.author: deeglaze
comments.body: Ah, the ::import was a copy/paste error. Thanks.

issues.title: CoRIM must be a "normative" reference
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body: It is currently in the "informative" block.

issues.title: wrong default repo?
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
When I clone this repo I get:
```
➜  deeglaze gh repo clone deeglaze/draft-deeglaze-amd-sev-snp-corim-profile
Cloning into 'draft-deeglaze-amd-sev-snp-corim-profile'...
[...]
From https://github.com/martinthomson/internet-draft-template
 * [new branch]      main       -> upstream/main
! Repository martinthomson/internet-draft-template set as the default repository. To learn more about the default repository, run: gh repo set-default --help
```
which doesn't sound right.

comments.author: deeglaze
comments.body: I turned off the template repo setting. I don't see this same `* [new branch]` output on clone.

issues.title: examples with too long lines
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
They render suboptimally.

I suggest running `fold -w72` automatically on all the CBOR diagnostic files.

issues.title: Use `tag` for the profile URI
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
I suggest using the `tag` scheme for the profile identifier. We started with `http` too, but then moved to `tag` to avoid the URL being de-referenced. E.g.: `tag:amd.com,2024:please-permalink-me`

An alternative is to use `urn` which, in case you plan to move the document to RFC, would (one day) give you the fancy and compact `urn:ietf:rfc:rfcXYZ`. The problem with this is that until the document gets ratified you can't know what the value is ;-)

So, in general, `tag` looks safer and more usable than the alternatives.

issues.title: Raw value type is extended too
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
S3.1.2:

> _"The only extensions are to $$flags-map-extensions."_

but `$raw-value-type-choice` is also extended.

issues.title: Need better explanation and CDDL semantics for each measured elements
issues.author: yogeshbdeshpande
issues.body:
The existing format of tagging just mkey with the individual measurement seems to lot less clear.

I would re-structure the sections in the following format:

* Primary Guest Measurement
Describe the mkey as uint with value as 0

Describe the measurements associated with this key
example:
GUEST_SVN  as Bla bla


Then a full DIAG of the measurement-map expressing the {
mkey: 0
Mval: {}

* Guest Policy
*

Finally Also indicate which all from the above, is expected to be conveyed in a single CoMID..?

Express the CoMID in the example in the same document.
